qas.question: When was the 50th anniversary of BBC news broadcasts?
On what form of media was a retrospective of the BBC's news broadcasts released to commemorate its 50th anniversary?
In what format were the BBC's first new bulletins shown?
What reality series was awarded a BAFTA in 2005?
What was the date the BBC celebrated the fiftieth anniversary of its television newsreel?
What kind of edition of Times Radio was produced?
What series won a BATFA award?
What was the first reality television show on BBC?

context: On <a0_0><b4_0>5 July 2004<b4_0/><a0_0/>, the BBC celebrated the fiftieth anniversary of its television news bulletins (although it had produced the Television <a2_0>Newsreel<a2_0/> for several years before 1954). This event was marked by the release of a <a1_0>DVD<a1_0/>, which showed highlights of the BBC's television coverage of significant events over the half-century, as well as changes in the format of the BBC television news; from the newsreel format of the first BBC Television News bulletins, to the 24-hour, worldwide news coverage available in 2004. A <b5_0>special edition<b5_0/> of Radio Times was also produced, as well as a special section of the BBC News Online website. In 2005 the pioneering BBC television series <a3_0><b6_0>Little Angels<b6_0/><a3_0/> won a BAFTA award. <b7_0>Little Angels<b7_0/> was the first reality parenting show and its most famous episode saw Welsh actress Jynine James try to cope with the tantrums of her six-year-old son.
